This is an example of a calendR output for a single month. 

Making a calendar for a month allows one to add text to specific days instead of just color-coding days.

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

library(ggplot2)
library(calendR)

datesFeb <- rep(NA, 28)
datesFeb[c(1:3)] <- "J-term"
datesFeb[c(4:13)] <- "Winter break"
datesFeb[c(14:28)] <- "Spring semester"

february23 <- calendR(year=2023, month=2,
                    title="February 2023",
                    weeknames=c("Sun", "Mon", "Tues", "Weds", "Thur", "Fri", "Sat"),
                    start="M",
                    lty=1,
                    special.days=datesFeb,
                    special.col=c("lightyellow", "lightyellow", "lightblue"),
                    text=c("End of J-term", "Start of winter \nbreak", "Start of spring\n semester"),
                    text.pos=c(2, 3, 14),
                    text.size=2.5,
                    text.col=1,
                    legend.pos="bottom")

print(february23)
```
